intro.description: Diffraction tool provides a fitting routine that can be used to accurately identify beam centre location from circular scattering profiles.

item.title: Open Diffraction tool page
item.description: Select "Diffraction" tool from image tools button from the toolbar in "Dataset plot" view.

item.title: Beam centre setting option
item.description: There are two options for setting beam centre location in "Diffraction" tool: single-click centring or circle fitting routine. They are accessible from toolbar buttons with tooltips "One-click bean centre" and "Select 3 or 4 points on ring...".

item.title: Identifying beam centre (one-click)
item.description: For the case of one-click beam centring, select one-click beam centre button in the toolbar of the "Diffraction" tool view and click on the beam centre position on the image.

item.title: Identifying beam centre (circle fitting)
item.description:
Circle fitting routine can find beam centre by fitting diffraction rings of the calibrant sample (e.g. AgBe). Select fitting action on the toolbar in the "Diffraction" tool view. Select 3 or 4 points on the diffraction ring, double-clicking on the last point to finish selection process. When point selection if finished, centre of the fitted circle will be marked as a beam centre position.
Clicking on "Refine beam centre" button on the toolbar will try to improve the initial fit by searching for more points on the selected ring and rerunning fitting routine.

item.title: Editing beam centre values
item.description: If beam centre position is known, corresponding values can be entered into "Beam Centre" section of the table in the "Diffraction" tool view.

item.title: Plotting calibration rings (optional)
item.description: If beam centre, energy and detector distance (it is determined at the end of the calibration process) are set correctly, calibration rings can be visualised by selecting "Calibrant" option in "Resolution rings" button on the toolbar and selecting the appropriate calibrant under "Calibrants" button.

item.title: Locking and saving metadata
item.description:
Beam centre position, together with the rest of the settings in the "Diffraction" tool (including energy and detector distance) can be locked using the lock button on the toolbar. This will apply currently locked settings to all subsequently open images.
Metadata can be also saved into a file and then imported back from this file using "Export metadata to file" and "Import metadata from file", respectively.
